item.title: Pentesting with Metasploit the Vulnerability Exploitation Tool (with Cheat Sheets)
item.description: Metasploit is the ultimate penetration testing tool for offensive security. And it’s so easy to use that even you could claim to be a hacker just by running a few commands. Also, it is incredibly powerful as well. This guide is a general overview of how Metasploit can be used.

item.title: Pentesting with Nmap the Network Testing Tool (with Cheat Sheets)
item.description: Nmap is a CLI based port scanner. As modern networking relies heavily on TCP ports, scanning these ports can expose valuable and critical data about a device on the network. These data can then be used to understand where vulnerabilities lie and how potential hackers can use them. Thus learning to port scan using Nmap is one of the first things a security researcher needs to grasp.

item.title: Kali as a Regular Operating System
item.description: If you are an aspiring pentester you should definitely use Kali Linux and make it your primary OS. Switching to a new OS can be a very hard decision to make. Concerns such as whether you can do your regular work may rise. It has been quite a while (3 years) since I am using Kali as my primary OS and here are my experiences with it.
